abstract: Cloudera, a new start-up company, will try to bring Hadoop’s analytical capabilities to industries as far afield as genomics, retailing and finance.
snippet: Cloudera, a new start-up company, will try to bring Hadoop’s analytical capabilities to industries as far afield as genomics, retailing and finance.
lead_paragraph: BURLINGAME, Calif.  In the span of just a couple of years, Hadoop, a free software program named after a toy elephant, has taken over some of the world’s biggest Web sites. It controls the top search engines and determines the ads displayed next to the results. It decides what people see on Yahoo’s homepage and finds long-lost friends on Facebook.

headline.main: Hadoop, a Free Software Program, Finds Uses Beyond Search
headline.print_headline: Hadoop, a Free Software Program, Finds Uses Beyond Search

abstract: The Electronic Privacy and Information Center asks the F.T.C. to regulate Google’s cloud computing services.
snippet: The Electronic Privacy and Information Center asks the F.T.C. to regulate Google’s cloud computing services.
lead_paragraph: The Electronic Privacy Information Center asked the Federal Trade Commission on Tuesday to investigate the privacy and security safeguards of Gmail, Google Docs and other so-called cloud computing services offered by Google to consumers.

headline.main: Privacy Group Asks F.T.C. to Investigate Google

abstract: Google names a sales executive in Europe to replace Tim Armstrong, who is leaving to become chief executive of AOL.
snippet: Google names a sales executive in Europe to replace Tim Armstrong, who is leaving to become chief executive of AOL.
lead_paragraph: Moving quickly to fill the void left by Tim Armstrong’s departure to AOL, Google said on Tuesday that Dennis Woodside, the company’s top sales executive in Britain and part of Europe, would become vice president for Americas operations.

headline.main: Google Gives Executive in Europe Top U.S. Sales Job
